ActNuclear Safety and Control Act
SubjectRegulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Nuclear Safety and Control Act
PrecisRegulations Amending CERTAIN REGULATIONS MADE UNDER THE NUCLEAR SAFETY AND CONTROL ACT in order to (1) update and clarify existing requirements for radiation protection during an emergency with current international standards and practices; (2) ensure that human performance and fitness for duty are addressed by licensees of Class I nuclear facilities to support workers in conducting their daily tasks and to be prepared to effectively respond to nuclear emergencies; (3) ensure that nuclear power plant licensees undertake regular reviews against modern codes and standards to identify safety improvements to their facilities to ensure their continued safe operation; (4) modernize the Class I Nuclear Facilities Regulations and the Uranium Mines and Mills Regulations to reflect the nuclear industryâ€™s best practice of placing paramount focus on safety through the implementation of a management system; and (5) update the Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission) to reflect the amendments to the Radiation Protection Regulations.
